page.title: 19WINSON CHURCH
page.content: The church of St.Michael and All Angels dates from early Norman times and has always been joined to Bibury as a chapelry. It stands on the highest point of the village, in open and peaceful countryside. It is a simple church with neither tower nor spire and has several unusual ancient features. On the North side the Norman doorway has been blocked, and on this side is the one remaining original window, in the chancel, its head carved from a single stone. On entering the church the most striking feature is the chancel arch whose jambs lean outwards. On the shafts of the porch can be seen several votive crosses crudely carved and initialled or dated. There are two services a month, a Holy Communion Service and a Morning Prayer, attended by a small, faithful congregation.
